Pre-Game Insights: The St. Louis Cardinals will face off against the Milwaukee Brewers on September 2, 2024, at American Family Field in Milwaukee at 2:10 PM EDT.
This matchup is vital for both teams as they navigate through the final stretch of the regular season.
The Cardinals currently sit third in the NL Central with a record of 69-68, while the Brewers lead the division at 80-57.
Historically, this season has seen the Brewers hold a 7-3 advantage over the Cardinals in their head-to-head matchups.
Milwaukee's home record stands strong at 40-25, and they are particularly effective when hitting multiple home runs, boasting a 30-8 record under such circumstances.
Recent performances indicate that the Brewers have a .257 batting average with a 2.86 ERA over their last ten games, while the Cardinals have fared slightly better at .290 with a 4.40 ERA.

As for the starting pitchers, we have Andre Pallante for the Cardinals with a record of 6-6 and a 3.80 ERA, while Freddy Peralta will take the mound for the Brewers, holding a 9-7 record and a 3.70 ERA.
